Yes, there are many grassroots organizations focused on environmental issues that you can get involved with, Here are just a few examples:

1. The Sierra Club - The oldest and largest grassroots environmental organization in the United States, the Sierra Club works to protect the environment and promote renewable energy.

2. 350.org - An international grassroots environmental organization that aims to build a global movement to address climate change and promote renewable energy.

3. Greenpeace - An international environmental organization that uses peaceful protest and direct action to promote environmental awareness and solutions.

4. Friends of the Earth - An environmental organization that fights for environmental and social justice and advocates for a just transition to a sustainable society.

5. The Nature Conservancy - An environmental organization that works to protect lands and waters around the world and promote sustainable natural resource management.

These are just a few of many organizations out there, so I encourage you to look into organizations that align with your interests and values, and see what ways you can contribute to help sustain our planet.
